hints.label: thm-stress-energy-convergence
hints.title: Stress-Energy Tensor Convergence
hints.content:
594: :label: thm-stress-energy-convergence
595: 
596: Let $T^{(N)}_{\mu\nu}$ be the discrete stress-energy tensor {prf:ref}`def-stress-energy-discrete` and $T_{\mu\nu}$ be the continuum tensor {prf:ref}`def-stress-energy-continuum`. Assume:
597: 
598: 1. **Existing mean-field convergence** ([20_A_quantitative_error_bounds.md](20_A_quantitative_error_bounds.md)): The empirical measure converges:
599: 
600: $$
601: W_2\left(\mu^{(N)}_t, \mu_t\right) \leq C\left(\frac{1}{\sqrt{N}} + \Delta t\right)
602: 
603: $$
604: 
605: 2. **Moment bounds**: The velocities satisfy $\mathbb{E}[\|v\|^4] < \infty$ uniformly in $N$
606: 
607: 3. **Fitness regularity**: $\Phi \in C^2(\mathcal{X})$ with $|\Phi(x)| \leq C_\Phi(1 + \|x\|^2)$
608: 
609: Then for any test function $\phi \in C_c^\infty(\mathcal{X})$:
610: 
611: $$
612: \left|\int_{\mathcal{X}} T^{(N)}_{\mu\nu}(x,t) \phi(x) \, dx - \int_{\mathcal{X}} T_{\mu\nu}(x,t) \phi(x) \, dx\right| \leq C_{\mu\nu}(\phi) \left(\frac{1}{\sqrt{N}} + \Delta t\right)
613: 
614: $$
615: 
616: where $C_{\mu\nu}(\phi)$ depends on $\|\phi\|_{C^2}$ and the constants $C$, $C_\Phi$.
